meanings.definition: To emerge again or come back into view or attention.
meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, the sun remerging from behind the clouds brought warmth to the land.
meanings.sent2: The stars remerging in the night sky signaled the end of the eclipse.
meanings.sent3: The shy rabbit kept remerging from its burrow, only to quickly hide again.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter remerging after a long silence filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood remerging in her mind were vivid and colorful.

meanings.definition: To rise or come up again after sinking or disappearing.
meanings.sent1: The bubbles remerging to the surface indicated that the diver was coming back up.
meanings.sent2: The submarine remerging from the depths of the ocean amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The toast kept remerging from the toaster, never quite done to perfection.
meanings.sent4: His determination remerging after the setback was like a phoenix rising from the ashes.
meanings.sent5: The melody remerging in the music brought back nostalgic feelings.
